questions.question_text: A customer is experiencing issues connecting to a server over the network during normal business hours. Historically, the connection has worked fine, but it has become intermittent over the past 24 hours. Sometimes the share is available, and sometimes the customer gets an error. A technician researches the issue and discovers a new IT vendor visited the customer's site and installed some new computer equipment without consulting the internal team. Which of the following represents the MOST likely reason the customer is having issues connecting to the server?

choices.B: There is an IP address conflict on the network.
choices.D: Disabled legacy protocols need to be updated.
choices.C: A firewall is blocking the SMB ports.
choices.A: A server was taken offline for routine maintenance.

comments.content: But wouldn't that prevent any connection from happening whatsoever?
intermittent network issues usually because of IP conflict

discussion.content: Can someone explain why IP conflict is the answer?

questions.question_text: A company wants to cost-effectively improve efficiency in navigating to client sites and reduce cellular data costs. Which of the following actions would be BEST to meet these requirements?

choices.D: Purchase new laptops with mapping software.

discussion.content: some older cars have a built in gps that is stand alone lol so this is almost like a trick question
Garmin GPS or a Tom Tom is cheaper than Google Maps on your smartphone using data...
man i feel this question is so dated

questions.question_text: A technician needs to implement a database in the cloud but does not want to manage any server infrastructure. Which of the following solutions would BEST meet this requirement?

discussion.content: I don't see this concept in the Official Guide ...
would it not be PaaS?

DaaS ist not "Database as a Service", but "Desktop as a Service".
I think "Software as a Service" is the Solution, and the Software should be in this case a Database-Software

Selected Answer: B
Its PaaS i did the az-900 and az-104 before and now database and everything handled in the cloud are always PaaS according to the Microsoft books

Daas if for endusers 
i will go with PaaS

The only reason why I think the answer can be D is because DaaS (according to the internet) "can be defined as a cloud computing service model. With it, the users are provided access to a database without having the need to set up physical hardware". And a server can fall in hardware. But why is this question even on here when its not on the objectives?

questions.question_text: A technician creates a VM in a public cloud to test a new application and then deletes the VM when finished. Which of the following BEST describes this type of cloud environment?

discussion.content: On-demand computing is an enterprise-level model of technology by which a customer can purchase cloud services (like installing a VM) as and when needed. For example, if a customer needs to utilize additional servers for the duration of a project, they can do so and then drop back to the previous level after the project is completed (deleting VM after using it).
Can someone explain this please??

questions.question_text: Which of the following connector types would MOST likely be used to charge a laptop computer?

discussion.content:
Believe the correct answer is B
You can charge a laptop that has a USB-C, https://store.hp.com/us/en/tech-takes/3-different-ways-to-charge-laptop-without-charger
The Lightning connector is a small connection cable used with Apple's mobile devices (and even some accessories) that charges and connects the devices to computers and charging bricks. The lightening connector is used to charge iPhone or iPad. The cable (emphasis on cable) can be used to charge the iPhone or iPad by plugging it into the USB port of a computer.
This did not specify if it is Windows or Mac, so I will go with B.

Selected Answer: D
... lightning is what is used for many docking stations and looks just like usb c. There is more than one kind of lightning guys.

Selected Answer: B
100% USB C, even if it's a MAC, no MACs use lightning ports for charging!
Apple user here and Lightning has never been used as a laptop charger. Lightning is mainly for iPads, iPhones, and iPods...
https://www.shareus.com/computer/usb-c-vs-lightning-which-is-better.html
lol this one is definitely type C

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B.
This is completely stupid. I have never seen a laptop using a lightning cable. This exam is *******
The correct answer is B
agree correct should be B. Lightening doesn't charge laptops (although does charge apple mobiles etc). But you can charge laptops over USB-C
